content: Seems like cargo clippy --fix still requires nightly -- what do we need for stabilizing this? It seems like the decision isn't actually in our hands but I might be missing something
I think it just has to go through the release process. Doesn't it work with the beta compiler?
Yes, cargo clippy --fix works with beta. This will be stabilized get into stable with 1.55.
I've been trying to use --fix and it hasn't worked. Is it supported for the semicolon_if_nothing_returned lint?

The suggestion has the applicability "MaybeIncorrect". rustfix#200 has a discussion on how these should be applied. For now, you can try to set __CARGO_FIX_YOLO=1 to apply that suggestion. (That'll also apply "MaybeIncorrect" suggestions from my understanding :upside_down: )
